alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 1:25PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...SERIES OF WINTER STORMS WILL BRING IMPACTS TO PORTIONS OF WESTERN NEVADA THROUGH MID-WEEK... * A relatively weak system will move into the area Saturday afternoon and evening hours. Outside of ridge tops, winds are not expected to be a concern. A few light rain showers (or a rain/snow mix) will be possible Saturday evening into the overnight hours, mainly along and west of Highway 95. Measurable precipitation will be minimal, if any. * A second, stronger system will quickly arrive early Sunday. Snowfall amounts of 1 inch or less will be possible early Sunday, along and west of Highway 95 with little to no accumulation elsewhere. Combined liquid totals from rain and snow will generally be 0.15 inches or less across the area. * A potent Atmospheric River is still expected to impact the area Monday into Tuesday of next week. This system will bring copious amounts of moisture and precipitation to the region. Along river basins and cities that predominately see just rainfall, some isolated urban and small stream flooding concerns is possible. However, there remains some degree of uncertainty in snow levels, especially on Monday during the onset of the storm. Conditions are favorable for heavy/wet snow with high precipitation rates on Monday particularly along and west of Highway 95, even in the lowest valleys. With that said, there is a chance that snow levels will remain just above major urban centers. This will mean the difference of flooding concerns or heavy/wet snowfall. Impacts are likely either way for many locations, so it is advised to check roadway conditions before the Monday morning commute.
